newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish shares seen holding levels in thin market.
newsitem.headline: Danish shares seen holding levels in thin market.

text.p: Danish share prices opened slightly higher on Tuesday, with dealers expecting levels to hold in a thin market after the Dow recovery and given the strength of the dollar.

"The U.S. market seems to have bottomed out yesterday and this should shore up the Danish market so prices will hold. Turnover will probably remain low and foreign investor interest limited," one dealer said.
The KFX top-20 index had gained 0.29 point to 186.97 at 0705 GMT, after closing 2.60 point lower on Monday.
